channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rodmarton Street jn to Blandford street, 19th June
item.description:
Rubbish bags dumped on pavement at Rodmarton Street jn to Blandford street need to remove from pavement and fix it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19-22, Rodmarton Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose cardboard dumped on corner of Duke street and ryder street, 19th June
item.description:
Outside Thomas Heneage Art Books there is a rubbish collection point, so it is normal to see bags waiting to be collected. But the cardboard that has been left is loose and without a sticker for someone to pick it up. The cardboard is mostly addressed to 9 Ryder Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Duke Street St James's, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance door, 19th June
item.description:
It doesn't close properly and we have issues with drug dealers and addicts lurking in the stairwells. It is dangerous for us ladies coming into our stairwells. Anyone can get in
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartville Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Cat on industrial locked industrial lot, 19th June
item.description:

item.title: Cooking oil being poured down drain, 19th June
item.description:
There is clear signs that oil is being disposed of down a drain in Canning Cross. The George Canning does not have a restaurant so is unlikely to be be responsible. However there are 2 other food outlets around the corner that may be pouring spent kitchen oil down the drain
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Grove Lane, Camberwell, London

item.title: Thorny foliage encroaching onto the pavement, 19th June
item.description:
Thorny foliage (blackberry bushes) is encroaching onto the pavement from the front garden of 1 Beaumont Road. This is dangerous as school children walk by on their way to school and the thorny bushes could hit them in the face or eyes. Please can you contact the property owner and request that these bushes are clipped back to the property boundary as soon as possible. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive Flytips!, 19th June
item.description:
Massive Flytip partially blocking entrance to Weir Hall Avenue cul-de-sac N18. This must have been dumped by someone using a van or lorry so surely Enfield Council will be gathering video doorbell evidence and CCTV footage to investigate this.....Won't you?? Residents are sick and tired of people just dumping stuff around here because they know there is no consequences!!! I watched a guy come out of his house the other day and dumped stuff on the grass outside my house and just laughed at me when I challenged him. Enfield Council need to do something that stops this illegal dumping!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Hall Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
